channel.title: I Need Help
channel.description:
There are three things I need help with... Provide the information I am to add and where to add it... Thanks
• Making someone a member • Adding Portals to take you somewhere • Making portals members only
If you can help with these that would be greatly appreciated..

item.title: I Need Help
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

Calm down dude… in client.java find

//QUEST_1 OBJECTS

and under that add the code… and shut up dude im giving you help, if you want help respect others.

item.title: I Need Help
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

[quote=“Da 0wnz, post:7, topic:181267”]No No No Dragonchain… I mean where do I place this:

case ####: // sendMessage("MESSAGE !"); teleportToX = XCOORD; teleportToY = YCOORD; heightLevel = 0; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { sendMessage("Make ur message.."); } break;

Thats the portal stuff he gave me and it was number[/quote]]

Oh, if your talking about “####” thats where you put the object id of the portal.

Read full topic

Lol, whats the number two for?

1 = is a member

item.title: I Need Help
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

[quote=“Hockey4lifexx, post:3, topic:181267”]1. go into your character folder and where it says character-ismember = 0 change the 0 to a 1.
2. Make a case and make the portal teleport u somewhere
ex:

case ####: // sendMessage("MESSAGE !"); teleportToX = XCOORD; teleportToY = YCOORD; heightLevel = 0; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { sendMessage("Make ur message.."); } break;
that would take u to an area with jad (in my server)
3. Adding a members only to a portal would be done as so:

case ####: // memberportal if(playerIsMember == 1) teleportToX = XCOORD; teleportToY = YCOORD; sendMessage("MESSAGE"); if(playerIsMember == 0) sendMessage("MESSAGE"); break;

there u go[/quote]

^^

going into there character folder would be a hassle, why not use my command, and nice member portal code from czar.

Read full topic

item.title: I Need Help
item.dc:creator: @Hockey4lifexx Hockey4lifexx
item.description:
@Hockey4lifexx wrote:

  1. go into your character folder and where it says character-ismember = 0 change the 0 to a 1.
  2. Make a case and make the portal teleport u somewhere
    ex:

case ####: // sendMessage("MESSAGE !"); teleportToX = XCOORD; teleportToY = YCOORD; heightLevel = 0; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { sendMessage("Make ur message.."); } break;
that would take u to an area with jad (in my server)
3. Adding a members only to a portal would be done as so:

case ####: // memberportal if(playerIsMember == 1) teleportToX = XCOORD; teleportToY = YCOORD; sendMessage("MESSAGE"); if(playerIsMember == 0) sendMessage("MESSAGE"); break;

there u go

Read full topic

item.title: I Need Help
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

Trying to leech czar? Eh? Well anyways if your talking about a member command to make people members add this with your commands, customCommands()

:

else if(command.startsWith("givemember") && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Armo") || (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("O N E ring")))) { String name = command.substring(11); try { int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name); client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p]; c.playerIsMember = 1; c.savemoreinfo(); c.savechar(); c.disconnected = true; PlayerHandler.messageToAll = name+" has been given Membership by "+playerName; BufferedWriter bw = null; bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("data/members.txt", true)); bw.write(""+name+""); bw.newLine(); bw.flush(); } catch(IOException ioexception) { misc.println("membership.txt: error loading file."); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage(name+" either isn't online or doesn't exist"); } }

And make sure that in player.java where

//Setting Welcomescreen information

is below that you might see playerIsMember = 0 or 1;

make sure it is 0, and make sure you have members.txt

Read full topic
